intro: Argostemma septatum var. minus, commonly known as the lesser argostemma, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, white to pinkish flowers clustered in cymes. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical characteristics make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
